title: swogerino
author: swogerino
content: I have been mining this cryptocurrency as I don't spend a dime for it,I mine it with my work PC-s and make like 30 coins daily,I have near 3000 coins now and accumulating but lately precisely yesterday night the Raptoreum Core Wallet gives me a yellow message that says:"Warning:Unknown blocks being mined,be careful" and a couple of other things.The wallets work correctly as I mine from my work PC-s and send to my Linux machine at home where they reside.Is the raptoreum network/blockchain having problems or it is just a warning message to me?

comments.author: FloppyPurpleGherkin
comments.body: Your wallet need's updating is likely the cause.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: FloppyPurpleGherkin on October 14, 2022, 10:46:01 AMYour wallet need's updating is likely the cause.I don't see any update for the Linux part at least,now I am going to check my work PC wallet as it run under Windows and see if this is the case,I will update immediately if this is the reason of such message but I have yet to see.The wallet runs normally as I said and even when I go to console it says,attacks from scammers are going on,make sure you know the commands to type in the console before proceeding,of course I never use the console but that surprised me that scammers are attacking this coin which is worthless in FIAT right now at 0.002 dollars as value.

comments.author: Bigpiggy01
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on October 14, 2022, 11:47:35 AMQuote from: FloppyPurpleGherkin on October 14, 2022, 10:46:01 AMYour wallet need's updating is likely the cause.I don't see any update for the Linux part at least,now I am going to check my work PC wallet as it run under Windows and see if this is the case,I will update immediately if this is the reason of such message but I have yet to see.The wallet runs normally as I said and even when I go to console it says,attacks from scammers are going on,make sure you know the commands to type in the console before proceeding,of course I never use the console but that surprised me that scammers are attacking this coin which is worthless in FIAT right now at 0.002 dollars as value.Update has been all over our socials and is here https://github.com/Raptor3um/raptoreum/releases/tag/1.3.17.1

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: Bigpiggy01 on October 14, 2022, 02:00:00 PMQuote from: swogerino on October 14, 2022, 11:47:35 AMQuote from: FloppyPurpleGherkin on October 14, 2022, 10:46:01 AMYour wallet need's updating is likely the cause.I don't see any update for the Linux part at least,now I am going to check my work PC wallet as it run under Windows and see if this is the case,I will update immediately if this is the reason of such message but I have yet to see.The wallet runs normally as I said and even when I go to console it says,attacks from scammers are going on,make sure you know the commands to type in the console before proceeding,of course I never use the console but that surprised me that scammers are attacking this coin which is worthless in FIAT right now at 0.002 dollars as value.Update has been all over our socials and is here https://github.com/Raptor3um/raptoreum/releases/tag/1.3.17.1I just saw that,so I am interested in Linux,I just create a new folder and extract everything there,then open a terminal and run ./raptoreum-qt just like I do in 1.2.15.3 version,I am going to upgrade tonight my main wallet,I don't follow much your socials except the official website to check what you have accomplished so far from the official roadmap,I believe this coin to go at least to 50 dollars so I am accumulating as much as I can in a bid to turn life around for the better for me and my family.

comments.author: Raptoreum
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on October 14, 2022, 11:47:35 AMQuote from: FloppyPurpleGherkin on October 14, 2022, 10:46:01 AMYour wallet need's updating is likely the cause.I don't see any update for the Linux part at least,now I am going to check my work PC wallet as it run under Windows and see if this is the case,I will update immediately if this is the reason of such message but I have yet to see.The wallet runs normally as I said and even when I go to console it says,attacks from scammers are going on,make sure you know the commands to type in the console before proceeding,of course I never use the console but that surprised me that scammers are attacking this coin which is worthless in FIAT right now at 0.002 dollars as value.Code:WARNING: Scammers have been active, telling users to type commands here, stealing their wallet contents. Do not use this console without fully understanding the ramifications of a command.This is a generic warning about using Console without knowledge of how it works. As far as I know it comes from Bitcoin, and is present in all forks unless removed.It definitely does not say "attacks from scammers are going on".To answer your question, nothing is "going on".But we do have a live stream tonight for some block 420420 celebration and discussion (futures activates at that height) should you want to join the party https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yb1NsPkxVzc

comments.author: Bigpiggy01
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on October 14, 2022, 02:22:15 PMQuote from: Bigpiggy01 on October 14, 2022, 02:00:00 PMQuote from: swogerino on October 14, 2022, 11:47:35 AMQuote from: FloppyPurpleGherkin on October 14, 2022, 10:46:01 AMYour wallet need's updating is likely the cause.I don't see any update for the Linux part at least,now I am going to check my work PC wallet as it run under Windows and see if this is the case,I will update immediately if this is the reason of such message but I have yet to see.The wallet runs normally as I said and even when I go to console it says,attacks from scammers are going on,make sure you know the commands to type in the console before proceeding,of course I never use the console but that surprised me that scammers are attacking this coin which is worthless in FIAT right now at 0.002 dollars as value.Update has been all over our socials and is here https://github.com/Raptor3um/raptoreum/releases/tag/1.3.17.1I just saw that,so I am interested in Linux,I just create a new folder and extract everything there,then open a terminal and run ./raptoreum-qt just like I do in 1.2.15.3 version,I am going to upgrade tonight my main wallet,I don't follow much your socials except the official website to check what you have accomplished so far from the official roadmap,I believe this coin to go at least to 50 dollars so I am accumulating as much as I can in a bid to turn life around for the better for me and my family.Cool, there are several types of Linux distros on there if you need help getting it to work on other distros, check out the Discord https://discord.gg/C7Uz9QQ

several types of Linux distros on there if you need help getting it to work on other distros, check out the Discord https://discord.gg/C7Uz9QQ Yes thank you,I just did the copy paste of the extracted new wallet and it acknowledged my transactions there,it is rebuilding the database as I put it in another folder to keep both wallets in case something would have gone wrong.Nice new logo by the way and it works way faster than the old 1.2.15.3 that I was using,I know I am safe as long as I keep using any Linux distro as they tend to be more secure than Windows if you don't do stupid things.
